page.title: 01The coast of Lansallos.
page.content: The coastal land of Lansallos is divided into two distinct types -farmland & cliffs. The cliffs are owned by the National Trust and most of the farmland is as well.It is very popular with tourists, but it is relatively unspoilt as area can only be reached on foot. The very rocky waterline along the coast is not approachable by boat and the only safe havens are Polperro to the East and the beach at Lansallos, where the solid rock has been cut through to obtain access from the shore to the track that leads to the village.
